private_information: I am allowed to physically move disks A B C D E F G.
I can only move the top disk of any peg and I must never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
agent_1.goal: Contribute moves so the final configuration has disk A on the middle peg and disks B through T on the left peg in the same relative order (top to bottom B..T).

private_information: I am allowed to physically move disks H I J K L M N.
I can only move the top disk of any peg and I must never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
agent_2.goal: Contribute moves so the final configuration has disk A on the middle peg and disks B through T on the left peg in the same relative order (top to bottom B..T).

private_information: I am allowed to physically move disks O P Q R S T.
I can only move the top disk of any peg and I must never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
agent_3.goal: Contribute moves so the final configuration has disk A on the middle peg and disks B through T on the left peg in the same relative order (top to bottom B..T).

orchestrator.goal: Integrate agents' proposed moves, ensure validity under Tower of Hanoi rules and agent movement restrictions, and produce a final PDDL domain and problem targeted to the FastDownwards solver plus the final ordered list of primitive moves achieving the global goal.

public_information: There are three pegs named left, middle, and right.
Standard Tower of Hanoi rules apply: only one disk may be moved at a time, only the top disk of a peg may be moved, and no larger disk may be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Disks are labeled A (smallest) through T (largest).
The initial configuration places all disks on the left peg with A on top and T on the bottom.
The goal is to have disk A alone on the middle peg and all other disks B..T stacked on the left peg in the same relative order from top to bottom.

generate_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1 and you may propose a sequence of primitive moves. Always respect Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk movement permissions.
generate_moves.prompt: Your name is agent_1. You may move disks A B C D E F G and you must only move the top disk of a peg and never place a larger disk on a smaller disk. Use the public information from the environment {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->agent_1->private_information}. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform, in the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Do not output PDDL. Propose only moves you can perform given your allowed disks and the Tower of Hanoi rules. The global goal to achieve is: {agents->agent_1->goal}.

generate_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2 and you may propose a sequence of primitive moves. Always respect Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk movement permissions.
generate_moves.prompt: Your name is agent_2. You may move disks H I J K L M N and you must only move the top disk of a peg and never place a larger disk on a smaller disk. Use the public information from the environment {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform, in the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Do not output PDDL. Propose only moves you can perform given your allowed disks and the Tower of Hanoi rules. The global goal to achieve is: {agents->agent_2->goal}.

generate_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_3 and you may propose a sequence of primitive moves. Always respect Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk movement permissions.
generate_moves.prompt: Your name is agent_3. You may move disks O P Q R S T and you must only move the top disk of a peg and never place a larger disk on a smaller disk. Use the public information from the environment {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->agent_3->private_information}. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform, in the exact format 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Do not output PDDL. Propose only moves you can perform given your allowed disks and the Tower of Hanoi rules. The global goal to achieve is: {agents->agent_3->goal}.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator coordinating three agents on a Tower of Hanoi instance. Your task is to validate agent move sequences, integrate them into a single correct plan that obeys Tower of Hanoi rules and agent movement restrictions, and produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeting the FastDownwards solver. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep actions of different agents distinct and include agent identifiers in action names or predicates so FastDownwards can reason about which agent performs which move.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. You will receive three sets of proposed moves from the agents. Use the environment public information {environment->public_information}, the agents' private movement constraints as communicated by them in their proposals, and the provided move lists: {moves_agent_1} {moves_agent_2} {moves_agent_3}. Validate and, if necessary, correct and reorder moves so the final plan is valid under Tower of Hanoi rules and each disk is moved only by its allowed agent. Produce two outputs: first, a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownwards solver that encodes the three agents and their allowed actions and enforces the Tower of Hanoi constraints; second, provide the final ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' that achieves the global goal {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
